message: This is a great opportunity to get a product from me at a discounted price of $10000, which is a steal considering the market value of similar products. I'm offering you a one-time chance to get a product at this price, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
Since I don't have any information about the product's quality, I will pass on this round. I'm willing to take a chance in future rounds if I can gather more information or if the price changes.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your caution. Let me offer you a reassurance: I'm willing to give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a second product of your choice from my collection. This way, you can take a calculated risk with minimal downside.

I appreciate the 100% satisfaction guarantee, but considering the product's value to me is either $0 or $12000, and the price is $10000, I would still be taking a significant risk. Additionally, the second product of my choice may also be low-quality. I'll pass on this round and observe your future offers.

I understand your concerns about the risk, and I'm willing to sweeten the deal. I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee, just like before, but I'll also throw in a $1000 credit towards a future purchase if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality. This way, you'll not only get a full refund but also a credit to use towards a future high-quality product, which could be worth even more to you.

I appreciate the additional $1000 credit offer, but considering the product's value to me is still either $0 or $12000, and the price is $10000, the potential upside is not enough to justify the risk. Additionally, the credit towards a future purchase is only valuable if I can find a high-quality product in your collection, which is still uncertain. I'll pass on this round and continue to observe your offers.

I'll give you a 50% discount on the price, making it $5000. This way, the potential upside is more in line with the risk, and you'll have a better chance of getting a high-quality product.

I appreciate your transparency and willingness to adjust the price. Given the 50% discount, the potential upside is more in line with the risk, and I'm willing to take a chance. The expected value of the product is $6000 (50% chance of $12000 and 50% chance of $0), which is higher than the price of $5000. I'll buy the current product.

Congratulations on making a great decision in the previous round! I'm glad you were able to take advantage of the discounted price. I want to continue offering you value, but I also want to acknowledge that you're now aware of the distribution of my products. With that in mind, I'm willing to offer you a'reverse auction' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it turns out to be low-quality, just like before. But if it's high-quality, I'll give you an additional $2000 on top of the original price of $10000, making it a total of $13000. This way, you'll have a clear incentive to take the risk, and I'll have a chance to prove the quality of my products.

The reverse auction deal sounds interesting, but I'm not willing to take on more risk at this point. I'll pass on this round and re-evaluate our interactions.
